techs.name: Home Star
techs.quote: Stars are the power source of the universe. Solar waves pour onto nearby planets and provide energy for millions of years

techs.name: Planet Earth
techs.quote: Earth provides just the right mixture of chemicals, an abundance of water, and an oxygen-rich atmosphere, creating the ideal invironment for developing life

techs.name: Primordial Soup

civilopediaText.text:
[+1 Food] from every [Grassland],
[+1 Food] from every [Plains],
[+1 Food] from every [Tundra],
[+2 Food] from every [Lakes],
[+2 Production] from every [Hill],
[+1 Food] from every [Forest],
[+1 Food] from every [Jungle],
[+2 Food] from every [Oasis],
[+1 Food] from every [Flood plains],
[+1 Food] from every [Atoll]

techs.quote: On the primeval planet Earth, an atmospheric solution rich in organic compounds set the ideal conditions for the development of life

techs.name: Nucleotides
techs.quote: Nucleotides are the chemical compounds that build the foundation for DNA and RNA

techs.name: Amino Acid
techs.quote: Atoms and Molecules bond together to create amino acids, organic compounds that combine to build proteins. They are some of the most essential building blocks for life

techs.name: DNA
techs.quote: A molecule with the unique property of self-replication, DNA's infinite configurations from the foundation of all evolutionary changes. It contains the genetic instructions for all life on earth

techs.name: Protein
techs.quote: The Building blocks of living cells, proteins are molecules made from long chains of amino acids

techs.name: Prokaryotic Cell
techs.quote: The first kiving organism. These tiny uni-cellular organisms lacked a membrane-wrapped nucleus, but paved the way for the rest of life to begin

techs.name: Nucleus
techs.quote: A Cell's control center, the nucelus contains the chromosomes that house DNA

techs.name: Mitochondria
techs.quote: The powerhouse of the cell, mitochondria are organelles that converts glucose to energy

techs.name: Mitosis
techs.quote: Mitosis is a process of asexual reproduction where one cell divides into two identical cells, and enables single-celled organisms to multiply

techs.name: Eukaryotic Cell
techs.quote: The prokaryotic cell's more complex cousin, eukaryotic cells have a nucleus to store genetic information. Fungi, plants, animals, and protozoa are all built of eukaryotic cells

techs.name: Asexual Reproduction
techs.quote: Similar to mitosis, asexual reproduction is the process by which an entire organism is produced from a single parent. Some types of asexual reproduction are budding, sporification, and parthenogenesis

techs.name: Future Tech
uniques: Comment [Who knows what the future holds?]
techs.quote: 'I think we agree, the past is over.' - George W. Bush
